medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation of bone dysplasia associated with mild hypercalcemia and hypercalciuria, including kidney stones.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient D1 was first evaluated at age 8 years, showing limb deformities. He experienced painful gross hematuria at age 7.5 years leading to a diagnosis of nephrolithiasis. Patient D2 was first noted to have limb deformities at age 2 years and developed kidney stones at age 7 years. Both patients were slightly below the third percentile for height.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient D1 was hypotonic at birth and had bilateral foot deformities requiring corrective casting. He was treated with vitamin D, calcium, and phosphate between ages 3 to 5 years for presumed hypophosphatemic rickets. Patient D2's birth weight was 3650 g, details of other medical history Not specified.
medical_history.family_history: The father has limb deformities and is of Moroccan Jewish descent; there is a family history of celiac disease in a sister. The grandfather was also relatively short, but no other significant family conditions were mentioned.
